## For Beginner Course

**Dev 2DGame with Python**

To run a python game using Arcade library you need to install 2 thing:

- [Python](https://www.python.org/) running enviroment
- [Arcade](https://arcade.academy/) library
- [VSCode](https://code.visualstudio.com/download) editor

To install Python enviroment in Windows, check out [HERE](https://arcade.academy/installation_windows.html).
to install Python enviroment in Mac, check out [HERE](https://arcade.academy/installation_mac.html)

After you successfully install the Python enviroment, now it time to install Arcade library.

Open command window(Terminal in Mac), then execute this:

```
pip3 install arcade
```

Last, download VSCode as your python program editor, and pick up a python plugin, you would be ready as a professional to start your coding journey.

**Dev 2DGame with Lua**

Using Love2D to develop 2d game is much more intuitive than using python arcade, you just need to [DOWNLOAD](https://love2d.org/) a love2d program as an interpreter of you game code.

<Image src="downloadlove2d.png" colStart="null|2" w="full" overflow="hidden"/>

After that, you still need an editor [VSCode](https://code.visualstudio.com/download) to write lua code. Last but not the least, there is a very handy plugin [Love2d Made Easy](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=lwz7512.love2d-made-easy) to facilitate the lua writing and love2d program running process, saving your lots of time.


## For Advanced Course

To start with Godot game development, you just need one tool download:

- for [Window version](https://godotengine.org/download/windows)
- for [Mac version](https://godotengine.org/download/osx)
- for [Linux version](https://godotengine.org/download/linux)

## For Professional Course

There are 3 courses related to professional level, the recommended learning path for this level is:

Introduction to Coumputer Science --> Game Design Patterns --> Introduction to Game Development


**CS50's Introduction to Computer Science**

Coming soon ...

**Game Design Patterns**

The web version is [HERE](https://gameprogrammingpatterns.com/contents.html)

**CS50's Introduction to Game Development**

3 tools needed:

- [Love2D program](https://love2d.org/)
- [Unity3D LTS Release 2018.4.x](https://unity3d.com/unity/qa/lts-releases)
- [Blender](https://www.blender.org/download/)

## VS Code

üîß 1. Enable Auto Save on `onFocuseChange`. 

```
  Settings / User tab / Text Editor / Files / Auto Save - onFocuseChange
```

üîß 2. Enable Auto Reveal on File open, this is optional.

```
  Settings / User tab / Features / Explorer / Auto Reveal - true
```
  
This means each time you open a file, the left EXPLORER panel will scroll to focus file name.

üîë 3. Setup(unlock) Python program launch button

To run Python program in our universal code editor `VS Code`, we'll need create a `launch.json` file to let vscode know where to find our Python intepreter to run python code. This step would be covered in [Setup & First Game](/docs/arcade-install).

üîë 4. Setup(unlock) Lua program launch button

Like the Python program launch button, we also need a Lua program launch button. We achieve this by installing a VSCode called [love2d-made-easy](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=lwz7512.love2d-made-easy). This step would be covered in [Setup & First Game](/docs/love2d-install).
